io.github.thunderbots.lightning.opmode

Class SimpleOpMode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.OpMode
      • com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.LinearOpMode
        • io.github.thunderbots.lightning.opmode.LightningOpMode
          • io.github.thunderbots.lightning.opmode.SimpleOpMode
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Autonomous, TeleOp

    public abstract class SimpleOpMode
extends LightningOpMode
    A SimpleOpMode is an op mode that is designed to make the op mode programming process very easy. Many common functionalities are implemented in this class, so all subclasses have easy access to that functionality. An example of this is the automatic construction of a DriveSystem based on the return value of LightningOpMode.isHidden().
    Author:
    Zach Ohara

    • Method Detail

      • getDriveMotorNames

        protected abstract java.lang.String[] getDriveMotorNames()
        Gets an array of Strings representing the names of the motors used for driving.

        If the robot has four motors, this array should be in the format of: 

          [front left, front right, back left, back right]
        If the robot has only two motors, this array should be in the format of: 
          [left, right]
        Returns:
        the names of the driving motors.

      • createDriveSystem

        protected DriveSystem createDriveSystem()
        Constructs a DriveSystem that the robot should use. TankDrive is assumed by default, but this can be changed on an individual basis by overriding this method.
        Returns:
        a constructed DriveSystem that is specific to this robot or op mode.

      • getDrive

        protected DriveSystem getDrive()
        Gets a reference to the DriveSystem being used to control the robot.
        Returns:
        the drive system for this op mode.

      • initializeRobot

        protected void initializeRobot()
        Description copied from class: LightningOpMode
        Initializes the robot. This can be defined however it is seen fit by the specific overriding op mode.
        Specified by:
        initializeRobot in class LightningOpMode
